definition: A choreografie is a creative arrangement or composition of movements, typically performed by a group of individuals in a synchronized manner. It is commonly utilized in various artistic disciplines, such as dance, theater, and performance arts, to visually express ideas, emotions, or narratives through the coordination of bodily gestures and sequences.

examples.german: Die Choreografie des Tanzes war atemberaubend.
examples.english: The choreography of the dance was breathtaking.

examples.german: Die Choreografie wurde von einem renommierten Tänzer erstellt.
examples.english: The choreography was created by a renowned dancer.

examples.german: Die Choreografie des Musicals war sehr anspruchsvoll.
examples.english: The choreography of the musical was very demanding.

examples.german: Die Choreografie wurde von der Tanzgruppe perfekt ausgeführt.
examples.english: The choreography was perfectly executed by the dance group.

examples.german: Die Choreografie des Balletts war äußerst elegant.
examples.english: The choreography of the ballet was extremely elegant.
